The first choice maybe not so good, which is not compatible for previous versions. I think a warning is good enough. The arguments has been set default values, terminating the app maybe not good choice.

My solution:

  • add required argument to the DEFINE_* APIs. which can solve the problem of lacking some required args or typo.

  • add warning information for unparsed arguments.

I opened a PR, Feel free to share your thoughts.

body:
@wenwei202 @kheuton 
The first choice maybe not so good, which is not compatible for previous versions. I think a warning is good enough. The arguments has been set default values, terminating the app maybe not good choice. 

My solution:

- add **required**  argument to the [DEFINE_\*](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/platform/flags.py#L65) APIs. which can solve the problem of lacking some required args or typo.

- add warning information for unparsed arguments.

I opened a PR, Feel free to share your thoughts.
